parameters.name: startsWith
parameters.description: Returns list of symbols which starts with mentioned string

parameters.name: endsWith
parameters.description: Returns list of symbols which ends with mentioned string

parameters.name: contains
parameters.description: Returns list of symbols which contains mentioned string

parameters.name: equals
parameters.description: Returns symbol which matches mentioned string

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Returns symbols in the mentioned sorted order, should provide asc or desc

post.description: Creates a new symbol with single/multiple dates for 3d database(OFDB). Creates a symbol for 2d database(OFDB)

requestBody.description: Data for creating symbol in the database

3dOFDB.description: Object in content is mandatory and must contain date with atleast one iterative field

2dOFDB.description: Object in content is optional and should contain fields of the OFDB

put.description: Updates existing symbols for single/multiple dates or adds a new symbol/date within a symbol if not present in 3d database(OFDB). Updates an existing symbol field value or adds a new symbol if not present in the 2d database(OFDB)

requestBody.description: Data for updating symbol in the database

3dOFDB.description: Object in content is mandatory and must contain the field date and at least one iterative field

2dOFDB.description: Object in content is OPTIONAL and should contain fields already existing within your OFDB

Returns the end results of a long running request. The full URL is normally provided for you in the Location header of a finished long running response.
Returns the end results of a long running request. The full URL is normally provided for you in the Location header of a finished long running response.

put.description: Updates an existing symbol field value for single/multiple dates or adds a new symbol/date within a symbol if not present in 3d database(OFDB). Updates an existing symbol field value or adds a new symbol if not present in the 2d database(OFDB)

requestBody.description: Data for updating symbol in the database

3dOFDB.description: Object in content is mandatory and must contain the field date and at least one iterative field

2dOFDB.description: Object in content is OPTIONAL and should contain fields already existing within your OFDB

delete.description: Deletes all data specific to the symbol in both 2d and 3d database(OFDB). This includes all the dates related to that symbols in 3d database(OFDB)

get.description: Returns the end results of a long running request. The full URL is normally provided for you in the Location header of a finished long running response.

parameters.name: between
parameters.description: Returns list of dates which are between [start,end], dates should be in the respective order of start and end

parameters.name: equals
parameters.description: Returns the date which matches given date

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Returns list of dates which are before mentioned date

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Returns list of dates which are after mentioned date

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Returns dates in the mentioned sorted order, should provide asc or desc

post.description: Creates a new date with single/multiple symbols for a 3d database(OFDB).

requestBody.description: Required data for creating date in the database. At least one iterative field is required otherwise it will throw 400.

put.description: Updates existing dates for single/multiple symbols or adds a new date/symbol within a date if not present in 3d database(OFDB).

requestBody.description: Required data for updating date in the database

put.description: Updates an existing date field value for single/multiple symbols or adds a new date/symbol within a date if not present in 3d database(OFDB).

requestBody.description: Required data for updating date in the database

delete.description: Deletes all data specific to the date in 3d database(OFDB). This includes all the symbols related to that date

get.description: Returns the end results of a long running request. The full URL is normally provided for you in the Location header of a finished long running response.
Returns the end results of a long running request. The full URL is normally provided for you in the Location header of a finished long running response.

delete.description: Deletes data specific to the symbol and date from a 3d database(OFDB).

get.description: Returns the end results of a long running request. The full URL is normally provided for you in the Location header of a finished long running response.
Returns the data in the database(OFDB, OMS_OFDB, ECONOFDB) for the mentioned Symbol or Date. Atleast one parameter(Symbol/Date) is required. For a range of dates symbol parameter is mandatory.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Returns data for the symbol mentioned. e.g:sym1

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Return data for the specific date or range of dates mentioned.e.g:[date1,date2]

parameters.name: filterFields
parameters.description:
Can specify the fields on which you want to perform field filter operations e.g: ["PRICE","SECTOR"]

Note:

The request will respond with 400
1. If fields which are not present on OFDB are given.
2. If filterOps or filterValues query parameters are missing
   when filterFields is present.
3. If number of values given for filterOps, 
    filterFields, filterValues are different
4. If exactly one of symbol or date query parameter is not provided.

parameters.name: filterOps
parameters.description:
Can specify the field filter operations which you want to perform e.g: ["LT", "GTEQ", "CT"]
in respective order of values in filterFields query parameter.

The available field filter operations are :

For CHAR type fields:

"CT" : contains

"SW" : starts-with

"EW" : ends-with 

"EQ" : equals

For NUMERIC type fields:

"GT" : greater than

"GTEQ" : greater than or equals

"LT" : lesser than

"LTEQ" : lesser than or equals

"EQ" : equals

Note:

The request will respond with 400 
1. If operations other than the above mentioned are provided.
2. If numeric operations are given to char type fields instead of char operations.
3. If char operations are given to numeric type fields instead of numeric operations.
4. If filterFields or filterValues query parameters are missing
   when filterOps is present.
5. If number of values given for filterOps, 
    filterFields, filterValues are different
6. If exactly one of symbol or date query parameter is not provided.

parameters.name: filterValues
parameters.description:
Can specify the field filter values of the field filter operations e.g: [100, 20, "AB"]
in respective order of values in filterFields and filterOps query parameters .

Note: 

The request will respond with 400
1. If char values are given to numeric type fields.
2. If filterFields or filterOps query parameters are missing
   when filterValues is present.
3. If number of values given for filterOps, 
    filterFields, filterValues are different
4. If exactly one of symbol or date query parameter is not provided.

parameters.name: filterDatesOps
parameters.description:
Can specify the date filter operations which you want to perform e.g: ["LT", "GTEQ"].

The available date filter operations are :

"GT" : after

"GTEQ" : after or equals

"LT" : before

"LTEQ" : before or equals

"EQ" : equals"

Note:

The request will respond with 400 
1. If operations other than the above mentioned are given.
2. If filterDatesValues query parameter is missing when filterDatesOps is present.
3. If number of values given for filterDatesOps and filterDatesValues differ.
4. If symbol query parameter is not provided.

parameters.name: filterDatesValues
parameters.description:
Can specify the date filter values of the date filter operations e.g: [20200505, 20200303]
in respective order of values in filterDatesOps query parameter.

Note:

The request will respond with 400
1. If invalid date values are given
2. If filterDatesOps query parameter is missing when filterDatesValues is present.
3. If number of values given for filterDatesOps and filterDatesValues differ.
4. If symbol query parameter is not provided.

parameters.name: filterSymbolsOps
parameters.description:
Can specify the symbol filter operations which you want to perform e.g: ["CT", "SW"].

The available symbol filter operations are:

"SW" : starts-with

"EW" : ends-with

"CT" : contains

"EQ" : equals

Note:

The request will respond with 400
1. If operations other than the above mentioned are given.
2. If filterSymbolsValues query parameter is missing when filterSymbolsOps is present.
3. If number of values given for filterSymbolsOps and filterSymbolsValues differ.
4. If date query parameter is not provided.

parameters.name: filterSymbolsValues
parameters.description:
Can specify the symbol filter values of the date filter operations e.g: ["ab", "xy"]
in respective order of values in filterSymbolsOps query parameter.

Note:
The request will respond with 400
1. If filterSymbolsOps query parameter is missing when filterSymbolsValues is present.
2. If number of values given for filterSymbolsOps and filterSymbolsValues differ.
3. If date query parameter is not provided.

parameters.name: sortFieldName
parameters.description:
Can specify the name of field with respect to which user wants to sort data 

Note:
The request will respond with 400, If a field which doesn't exist in the OFDB is requested

parameters.name: sortFieldOrder
parameters.description:
Can specify the order in which user wants to sort data with respect to sortFieldName query parameter 

Note:
The request will respond with 400, If value other than asc or desc is requested

get.description: Returns the end results of a long running request. The full URL is normally provided for you in the Location header of a finished long running response.

post.description: Creates a 2d or 3d database(OFDB). Users will note that not every field requires all the parameters listed in the schema. Please review FactSet data types on the OA for further guidance.

get.description: Returns the end results of a long running request. The full URL is normally provided for you in the Location header of a finished long running response.

200.description: Creates and responds with ofdb path

GetDataByPath.description: The `path` value returned in the response can be used as the `path` parameter in `GET /v1/database/{path}/data`.

path.description: path of the newly created database.

UpdateDate.description: Set of fields along with symbol is mandatory to update the date.

data.description: date has to be provide in case 3d OFDB with date and atleast one iterative field

UpdateDates.description: Set of fields along with symbol is mandatory to update the date.

data.description: date has to be provide in case 3d OFDB with date and atleast one iterative field

UpdateSymbol.description: Any arbitary set of fields that are provided while creating the ofdb and their values.

UpdateSymbols.description: Any arbitrary set of fields that are provided while creating the ofdb and their values.

description.example: A user would fill this with relevant information

SuccessPostResponse.description: Response format of any kind of post response

id.description: id of the newly created resource

BulkDeleteArray.description:
A list of the various backend responses needed for the bulk delete. These typically contain data points that failed to be deleted, and are in the order of:
Delete values by symbol, date, and field + delete values by symbol and field
Delete dates by field + delete dates
Delete dates by symbol
Delete fields
Delete symbols

symbol.description: Names of the symbol and unique to this database

content.description: date must be provided in the case of a 3d ofdb with atleast one iterative field

BulkDeleteItem.description: Users may provide any combination of a symbol, date, and/or field to perform a bulk delete operation. For example, if a user provides both a symbol and a date within the same data point {} then the endpoint will delete the symbol for just that date. If they provide a symbol, date, and field then the endpoint will delete just that singular field entry point for that date for the given symbol. Providing singular entities within a {} will delete the complete data for that given value.

idPathParam.name: id
idPathParam.description: A unique pickup ID returned by the original request

ResponseLocationHeader.description: url of the newly created resource

Long-Running-Location.description: location to poll for the status of the job.

X-FactSet-Api-Request-Key.description: Key to uniquely identify an Analytics API request. Only available after successful authentication.

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: Number of allowed requests for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: Number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: Number of seconds remaining till rate limit resets.

Retry-After.description: Time to wait in seconds before making a new request as the rate limit has reached.

400Response.description: Invalid query parameter or value provided

200GetStats.description: Returns an object with key OFDB stats

200GetAudit.description: Returns a list of the most recent "modificationTimes" in long datetime format

200GetFields.description: List of fields within the database

201LongRunningResponse.description: Returns when the long running request is completed. The next pickup URL is provided by the Location header.

202LongRunningResponse.description: Returns when the request is moved to long running mode. The next pickup URL is provided by the Location header.

403Response.description: User is forbidden with current credentials

406Response.description: Unsupported Accept header. Header needs to be set to application/json

429Response.description: Rate limit reached. Wait till the time specified in Retry-After header value to make further requests.

500Response.description: Server error. Log the X-DataDirect-Request-Key header to assist in troubleshooting

503Response.description: Request timed out. Retry the request in some time
